description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if it is officially announced that an athlete or team that placed for any medal at the 2026 Milano-Cortina Winter Olympics has been disqualified or had their medal revoked due to an amendment to results that removes them from a podium position. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

Only disqualifications or medal revocations announced before the medals are awarded for the final event of the 2026 Milano-Cortina Winter Olympics will be considered. Any subsequent disqualifications, reallocations, or other changes to medal results after the conclusion of the final medal ceremony will not be considered.

If the 2026 Milano-Cortina Winter Olympics are partially completed and then cancelled or postponed after March 8, 2026 ET, this market will resolve to “No”.

If the 2026 Milano-Cortina Winter Olympics are entirely cancelled or postponed after March 8, 2026 ET, this market will resolve to “No”.

If a qualifying disqualification or medal revocation has already been officially announced prior to such cancellation or postponement, this market will resolve to “Yes”.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the International Olympic Committee (https://www.olympics.com/); however, a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

markets.question: Winter Olympics: Athlete to be stripped of medal?

title: Winter Olympics: Athlete to be stripped of medal?
